thread.title: These GIFs prove Justin Timberlake is having the best time at the Oscars
thread.title_full: These GIFs prove Justin Timberlake is having the best time at the Oscars

author: USA TODAY
title: These GIFs prove Justin Timberlake is having the best time at the Oscars
text:
These GIFs prove Justin Timberlake is having the best time at the Oscars Erin Jensen, USA TODAY 11:40 p.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 
How much fun is he having? 'Just imagine, just imagine, just imagine.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images) 
There's no question that Justin Timberlake is having the best time at the Oscars – except, perhaps, for the unsuspecting couple from the tour bus who was "married" by Denzel Washington. 
The former boy bander's night of fun started out on the red carpet. 
'Behold my pose,' Timberlake probably. (Photo: Christopher Polk, Getty Images) 
He photobombed his wife, Jessica Biel. 
Jessica, don't look now. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
That sneaky triple threat also hilariously photobombed Emma Stone during an interview. 
And, though it wasn't an *NSYNC reunion, Timberlake seemed to enjoy opening the show with his Oscar-nominated track Can't Stop the Feeling from the movie Trolls . 
After greeting his All New Mickey Mouse Club co-star, Ryan Gosling, Timberlake looked overjoyed busting out some moves. 
Bros. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images) 
He also broke into Lovely Day and headed into the audience to shake it with Halle Berry and best dressed Biel. 
Seriously, if you're thinking anyone else is having a better time than J. Timberlake, it's time to re-examine. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Mahershala Ali accepts the the Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for his role in 'Moonlight' during the 89th Academy Awards. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Alex Hibbert, foreground, and Mahershala Ali in a scene from the film, 'Moonlight.' David Bornfriend, AP Christopher Nelson, left, Giorgio Gregorini, and Alessandro Bertolazzi pose with their Oscars for Achievement in Makeup and Hairstyling for 'Suicide Squad' in the trophy room during the 89th Academy Awards. Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), Killer Croc (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje), Katana (Karen Fukuhara), Rick Flagg (Joel Kinnaman), Deadshot (Will Smith) and Captain Boomerang (Jai Courtney) are ready for action in 'Suicide Squad.' Clay Enos 'The Salesman' wins the Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film, Feb. 26, 2017 at the Academy Awards. IranShahab Hosseini, left, and Taraneh Alidoosti are in a scene from 'The Salesman.' AP O.J. Simpson is seen in ESPN Films docu-series, 'O.J. Simpson: Made in America.' The film received the Academy Award for Best Documentary. M. Osterreicher, Courtesy of ESPN Presenters Kate McKinnon, left, and Jason Bateman pose with Colleen Atwood and her Oscar for Achievement in Costume Design for 'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find The' in the trophy room during the 89th Academy Awards. Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY 'Fantatic Beasts and Where to Find Them' set in 1926 New York, hit U.S. theaters Nov. 18, 2016. Jaap Buitendijk Newt (Eddie Redmayne) and Tina (Katherine Waterston) are fugitives on a mission in 'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them.' Jaap Buitendijk Viola Davis accepts the Oscar for Best Supporting Actress for her role in 'Fences' during the 89th Academy Awards. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Viola Davis plays Rose Maxson in a scene from 'Fences.' David Lee, AP Amy Adams performs in a scene from 'Arrival.' The film won an Oscar for Sound Editing. Jan Thijs, AP Andrew Garfield in a scene from 'Hacksaw Ridge.' The film won an Oscar for Sound Mixing. Mark Rogers, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
